column4: its 2:10am and i am sitting twiddling my thumbs with a corrupt OS and no way to backup the data
meh
i thought ubuntu was a little more stable then this
What happened?
the huge thing decided to become corrupt and die after editing a config file...
The whole FS?  As in it doesn't boot past a fsck?
Or it won't boot at all?
yes, i've had crazy stuff happen, like being at the login prompt screen and in console shell at the same time, with both replying to my entries
What do you mean?
Do you mean that two terminals were accepting the input from your keyboard?

it replied to commands and login screen at once, said enter username, i entered, it said enter password - bad command, i entred password, it said invaid password and then it said invalid command or something
So it loads the GUI login manager?
no it dies after fsck on booting
that was on console login
Ah, okay, sorry.
Out of my support range, then.  :(
but it did different things the first 3 times i rebooted, now only its doing the same
exactly my point
You might just want to try scanning, repartitioning your disk and reinstalling.  It sounds like the FS has gotten corrupted?
it has... from a xorg setting :/
